Text:
(Two more weeks pass, and I'm somehow managing to
survive as Alexia's "boyfriend.")
Damn it, I wanted to ask her out...
He's such a gold digger.
Who's that guy again?

(Luckily, everyone is focused on the fact that Alexia
is even dating someone, and I'm able to get by as her
background character boyfriend.)

(Every once in a while, the other students bully
me, but it's nothing I can't handle.)

(I'm just relieved Mr. Zenon hasn't beaten the living
crap out of me or availed himself of any quick and
savage tricks to erase me from existence.)
(He doesn't approach me to shoot the breeze anymore.)
Hah!

(Still, he seems to laugh off our relationship as
inconsequential.)

(Alexia, on the other hand, seems to grow even more
antagonistic toward Zenon.)

(I would say they're both acting like adults who can
keep their work and private life separate.)
Seriously!

That jerkwad pisses me off. Thinks he's all that
just because he's all right with a sword.
Uh-huh, yup.
Pooch, I'm guessing you saw his fake-ass grin, too.
Yeah, yeah.
Don't give me that attitude.
Yes. ma'am.
(Alexia and I are taking the train back after class.)

(Although she is careful to maintain appearances in
front of others, behind the scenes, she curses like
a sailor.)

(Of late, we've gotten into the habit of taking a
small detour through a popular area in the
capital on the way back to her dorm.)

(I spend the whole time agreeing with her and seldom
retain more than 10 percent of our conversations.)

(I've turned into a yes machine. By this point, I
know disagreeing only wastes time.)

(It's sunset as we walk at an excruciatingly slow
pace through the capital. It should take about
ten minutes to walk its entirety, but it always
takes us half an hour.)

(On our way, Alexia stands patiently in line at an
ice cream shop despite being a princess of the
kingdom.)
You're a princess. Can't you just skip the line?

Of course, but the goal isn't to eat ice cream. It's
to spread the word about our relationship.
Ah, right...

(My dates with Alexia can go on so long that the
stars come out, but I keep my cool.)

(There are days when I feel like telling her to talk
to a brick wall, but I show some self-restraint then
too.)

(Patience, patience, patience. But there's one thing
I feel I have to say.)
Hey, can I ask you something?
What is it, Pooch?

What don't you like about Mr. Zenon? Objectively
speaking, he seems like a home run of a husband.
Have you been listening to me at all?
(Alexia asks, slightly vexed.)
I hate everything about him. His very existence.

I mean, he's a hot expert swordsman with titles,
prestige, moneyâ€”not to mention super popular
with the ladies.
(Alexia snorts.)
Yeah, on the surface.
Anyone can pretend. Take me, for example.

(Now that she mentions it, she's super-popular
because she's a master at wearing a mask in
front of others. Nauseatingly so.)
Wow, I'm suddenly completely convinced.
...Did you say something?
Nope.
Anyway, I don't judge people by their looks.
Then what do you look at?
Their flaws.
(Alexia smiles smugly.)

(Wow, what a negative approach. It suits her
perfectly.)

Just so you know, I don't mind you, even though
you've got nothing going for you.

Thanks. I'll take that as a compliment. So what are
Mr. Zenon's flaws?

(Alexia looks taken aback by the ice cream I hold out
for her,)
(before begrudgingly accepting it.)
He doesn't have any.
Sounds like a keeper.

Perfect people don't exist. I bet he's either a big
fat liar or totally messed up in the head.

I see. Thanks for that totally arbitrary and biased
answer.
You're welcome, my flawed pooch.
Here's your reward for today.
(Alexia tosses a ten thousand zeni coin into the air.)
...Huff!!!
Huff, huff, huff...woof!!!

I shove the coin in my pocket and return to Alexia,
who's clapping her hands in delight.

(She vigorously tousles my hair. I take this
opportunity to remember she's the worst.)
I can see the disgust in your face.
I'm letting you see it.
(Alexia giggles and gets up.)
All right. Let's head home.
Yeah, yeah.
(I obediently follow after Alexia.)
